subject: Re: Case studies

full_threads.body:
Hi Femke, 

Sure, no problems. Here is another video to show you how to bring that layout into your other case studies: 
https://www.useloom.com/share/1f0e01dac2a449ad859016a0fffc5018

Let me know if you need anymore help with this?

Hi Heath,



Thanks for this video again, I've found everything in the Fonterra case, but earlier cases (Macquarie and B2Hub) don't have that new lay out yet.



So I can't change the image in those..



Thanks again!




Femke Klaassens

Onderwerp: Re: Case studies


Hi Femke,

I am just trying to put in a Fonterra one which involves adding a section and a quote. Am struggling a bit so may need Heath to tidy up when I am finished. I'll let you know. When i need to add another quote, i just duplicate an old one, that's already there and change the text 😊 that should work 😊

Thanks for working out text thing - it's more complex than I am used to. Actually when I discovered in normal typing mode that if you expand the tool kit there is a type colour tool. I just hadn't expanded before. 😊NICE, thanks, didn't know that yet!

B2Hub - what are you asking Robby? I have the case study - it's on Sharepoint. Or were you asking something else? Is it designed yet? I thought it wasn't… Let me know!

The images being not round I think is because they need to be squarish to start with - the ones I uploaded were very widescreen and ended up as ovals. I'm happy for you to choose the images - Marina said they are on Sharepoint - choose ones that you think work. For the one that acts as a Header I feel we need to darken them off so the text pops more - what do you think? Darkening shouldn't be a problem, i'll throw it in photoshop and add a little filter. Definitely agree. I'll try and find them on sharepoint!

I am going out in a minute so Fonterra is very messy - I will come back to it tomorrow and try to figure a few more things out. Unfortunately Heath has moved now so I can't pop in on him any more.
will have a look at fronterra when you're out! Going to move coffee shops for a minute, tables are to high in this one haha! Might need a massage after this three week trip xD


Nicky Marshall


Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

From: Femke Klaassens <femke@veldhoencompany.com>
Date: Wednesday, 5 December 2018 at 4:06 PM
To: Nicky Marshall <nicky@veldhoencompany.com>, Marina Imhoff <marina@veldhoencompany.com>
Subject: Re: Case studies


Hi Nicky,

Looked into the problem with the font (white), and figured it out.

The solution lies in the text. When you're in the Text block, where you would normally just type. Go to tab "Text" and make sure to add <p style="text-align: justify; color:#FFF!important;"> before each paragraph. And and it with </p>.

I have now changed it in the Macquarie case!



About those images, strange, because I just added them to the image carrousel and that seems to work. There are now 4 pics for Macquarie on there! Only thing is, I can't make them nice and round as the other images in other case studies. I'll ask heath to fix.

Regarding b2hub - have send Robbie the case study, but are yet to receive an answer. Will shoot him another email asking how much time he needs still.

It's now a draft on the site. Do we have some pics, to add? (pics that we can use?)

(please check if logo is correct)

Femke Klaassens
Marketeer

Hi Femke,
Hope you arrived in Taiwan safely. I guess you will have jetlag for a while - no fun!

I changed the results in the Macquarie case study and tried to upload some pictures… but I need you help. The text in the Results box needs to be changed to white but I can't see where to do it. I also had trouble with the photos - I managed to get 3 in there but the other couple I was trying to set as an image just didn't want to. Can you please take a look and let me know where I am going wrong.

@Marina Imhoff - should we credit someone for the photos?

I also have a couple of other drafts for case studies (Fonterra and Cardinia). I thought I would get a head start and put them in to wordpress myself but when I "added a new Case study" the page doesn't seem set up in our format. Can you explain what I do, please. I assume there is a template somewhere but I'm not sure how to find it.

I see B2Hub is also not in there. Was there a reason for that? I have the script somewhere if you have lost it - or is there another reason?

All for now - looking forward to finally cracking these case studies.
Thanks
Nicky
